titleStmt.title: Die Mercurii 9. Maii, 1660. Ordered by the Lords and Commons in Parliament assembled, that the Armes of this common-wealth where ever they are standing, be forthwith taken down, and that the Kings majesties armes be sent up in stead thereof.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Macock, and Francis Tyton, Printers to the House of Lords,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
"The Kings's arms to be set up instead of the Commonwealth's" -- Cf. Steele.
Order to print dated: Die Mercurii 9. Maii, 1660. Signed: Jo. Browne, Cleric. Parliamentorum.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
